prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Model of a Sloped Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional model of a sloped rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.375, 0.0, 0.0 ] Next, create the 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Face 1 This face contains a single loop with the following six consecutive lines and their respective start and end points: - Line 1: Start Point [ 0.0, 0.0 ], End Point [ 0.0156, 0.0 ] - Line 2: Start Point [ 0.0156, 0.0 ], End Point [ 0.0156, 0.2344 ] - Line 3: Start Point [ 0.0156, 0.2344 ], End Point [ 0.25, 0.2344 ] - Line 4: Start Point [ 0.25, 0.2344 ], End Point [ 0.25, 0.25 ] - Line 5: Start Point [ 0.25, 0.25 ], End Point [ 0.0, 0.25 ] - Line 6: Start Point [ 0.0, 0.25 ], End Point [ 0.0, 0.0 ] Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter sketch\\_scale = 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion parameters: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal = 0.1875 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal = 0.1875 This concludes the creation of the first part. The sloped rectangular prism will be integrated with subsequent parts based on the operation defined in the CAD assembly JSON. Confidence: 90%</description>
completion:
<json>

</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a curved top edge and a flat bottom edge. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** * Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Create the first face of the sketch** * Begin a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system **Step 3: Draw the bottom line of the rectangle** * Create a line starting at [0.0, 0.217] and ending at [0.1758, 0.0] **Step 4: Draw the first vertical line of the rectangle** * Create a line starting at [0.1758, 0.0] and ending at [0.2902, 0.0] **Step 5: Draw the curved top line of the rectangle** * Create an arc starting at [0.2902, 0.0] * Set the midpoint of the arc to [0.3846, 0.0685] * End the arc at [0.4791, 0.0] **Step 6: Draw the second vertical line of the rectangle** * Create a line starting at [0.4791, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.217] **Step 7: Close the rectangle by connecting the last point to the first point** * Create a line starting at [0.75, 0.217] and ending at [0.0, 0.217] **Step 8: Scale the sketch by 0.75** * Apply the sketch scale parameter **Step 9: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** * Set the extrude depth towards the normal direction to 0.1262 * Set the extrude depth opposite the normal direction to 0 * Use the New Body Feature Operation to create a new solid body **Step 10: Note the dimensions of the part** * The length is 0.75 * The width is 0.75 * The height is 0.1262</description>
